net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.services

Class SingletonService

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.content.Context
      • android.content.ContextWrapper
        • android.app.Service
          • net.zerobandwidth.android.lib.services.SingletonService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.content.ComponentCallbacks2, SingletonServiceInterface

    public class SingletonService
extends android.app.Service
implements SingletonServiceInterface
    This service provides "singleton" instances of any specified class. This is done as an Android Service, instead of the normal Java singleton model, because Android tends to assign multiple class loaders during the life cycle of a single app, and thus static values (like singletons) set in one Activity might not be visible in another. By registering singletons with a Service, multiple Activitys can be more confident about getting their singletons from the same source.
    Since:
    zerobandwidth-net/android 0.0.1 (#1)

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  SingletonService.Binder
      An implementation of the Binder class which simply returns this instance of the service.
      static class  SingletonService.Connection
      A canonical implementation of the ServiceConnection interface, which simply acts as a pass-through for the public methods of the service itself.

      • get

        public <T> T get(java.lang.Class<T> cls)
        Description copied from interface: SingletonServiceInterface
        Returns the singleton instance of the specified class. If no singleton has been created yet, then null is returned. If a casting error occurs internally, then the method returns null but also logs a warning.
        Specified by:
        get in interface SingletonServiceInterface
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class for which a singleton should be returned
        Parameters:
        cls - the class for which a singleton should be returned
        Returns:
        the singleton instance of the class, or null if none can be obtained

      • put

        public <T> T put(java.lang.Class<T> cls,
                 T oInstance)
        Description copied from interface: SingletonServiceInterface
        Specifies the singleton instance of a given class. If no previous singleton has been set, then null is returned. If a casting error occurs internally while trying to pass back the previous instance, then null is still returned, but an error is also written to the logs.
        Specified by:
        put in interface SingletonServiceInterface
        Type Parameters:
        T - the class for which a singleton should be set
        Parameters:
        cls - the class for which a singleton should be set
        oInstance - the instance to be proclaimed as the singleton instance
        Returns:
        any previously-set singleton instance for that class, or null if none can be obtained

        Parameters:
        cls - the class for which a singleton should be returned
